intro: Coccothrinax barbadensis, commonly known as the royal palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the islands of the Lesser Antilles. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of long, feathery leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into dark blue fruits containing a single seed. This palm is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to coastal and tropical environments.
